標題： 【2024 Indigenous Knowledge Public Lecture Series】Colonial determinants of Indigenous wellness and health equity: From Japanese relocation to health governance in contemporary multicultural Taiwan
日期： Wed, 27 Nov 2024 15:47:09 +0800

Join us as we welcome our honored guests from West Sydney University,Australia.

【2024 Indigenous Knowledge Public Lecture Series】

◎Speaker : Dr. Ying-Tzu Ena CHANG
◎Topic : Colonial determinants of Indigenous wellness and health equity: From Japanese relocation to health governance in contemporary multicultural Taiwan
◎Date : 28 Nov 2024 10:00-12:00
◎Location : CIS A318

Speaker : Dr. Ying-Tzu Ena CHANG (Assistant Professor, Graduate Program of Multicultural Education, Hua-Shih College of Education)
Speaker Biography: Dr. Chang received her cotutelle PhD from the Department of Ethnic Relations and Cultures at National Dong Hwa University (NDHU) and the Department of Geography and Planning at Macquarie University, Australia. She is currently affiliated with the Graduate Program of Multicultural Education at Hua-Shih College of Education. Her research focuses on Indigenous wellness in eastern Taiwan through reconnection with land, people, and community cultures.
